p: Starting with an influenza A virus-positive sample pool (10 6 genome copies/ml), we made three volumetric dilution series using three independent influenza virus-negative pools ( Fig. 1B). The total quantity of cDNA after preparation for sequencing was consistently higher in all samples using negative pool 3 as the diluent ( Fig. 2A), indicating the presence of a higher concentration of nonviral RNA within pool 3. This is likely due to host cell lysis or higher bacterial presence and demonstrates the variable nature of throat swab samples.
